title: Ryder Cup 2025 live updates: Latest as Luke Donald names his Team Europe captain’s picks
description: Follow live as Donald today confirms his six captain’s picks for Team Europe
content:
Eduardo K: Whatever happens, Keegan has gained a ton of fans this past year. He has been under a lot of scrutiny, and has handled it all with grace. And deciding not to pick himself, when it could be his last chance to compete, says a lot as well. Keegan is all in on trying to do what is best for the US Ryder cup team, that is palpable. Hoping for the best for him.”

Kevin B: “I feel badly for him. The PGA of America put him in an untenable position. After not being selected last time, you knew he was super motivated to make the team this year. And, he played like he belonged. However, trying to wear two hats under today’s Ryder Cup environment would have been extremely difficult. Now, he will miss consecutive Ryder Cups as a player when he potentially could have been on both. Much respect for him for having to make a terribly difficult decision. Wishing nothing but success for him and his team in September.”

You can share your opinion by emailing live@theathletic.com.
summary: The decision to not pick himself for the upcoming Ryder Cup could be a significant decision for the future of the sport. The decision was made by the PGA of America, which put him in an untenable position. However, some fans have expressed their appreciation for the decision.
shortSummary: Despite his recent success, Keegan Smith's decision to stay away from the 2018 Ryder Cup was criticized by some.
argos_summary: Keegan, a prominent golfer, has gained fans after deciding not to compete for himself to prioritize the US Ryder Cup team. He faced scrutiny but handled it gracefully. The PGA of America placed him in a tough spot; he was motivated to make the team after missing selection last time. His choice means he will miss consecutive Ryder Cups as a player, but he is respected for the difficult decision.
